Reviews.Title: “If a decent pool is more important than a decent room”
Reviews.Author: orange66
Reviews.Content: A really ordinary place which I will try hard to avoid next time I am in Singapore. The staff were very pleasant and let me check in very early, but the room was grubby. It was an unrefurbished room, but that didn't mean that it had to be so unloved. I ended up telling my daughter not to touch the curtains, because every time they were moved, billows of old dust erupted from them. A hostess bar for decrepit Chinese gentleman tourists was off the main lobby. I didn't take the breakfast. Newton Hawker market is 5 minutes walk away, and open for breakfast. I did try the Bakuteh pork soup lunch set at the restaurant one day and it was fantastic. The pool was the high point of the stay. Spacious, clean, swimming with the stars above, and the sound of the traffic below was a nice way to finish up the day. A real mixed bag this hotel. If it was cleaner, I would give it a 3 or 4 easily.

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps it is good for some... But not for me :-(”
Reviews.Author: Sofocona
Reviews.Content: Was not thrilled... Hotel needs some refurbishing.. Rooms are not in a good shape.. Very cold AC and hard mattresses... Had a hard time to get internet connection, which was finally discovered at the lobby in old computers with tokens... It had a gentlemen's club as part of the amenities... So-so food.. But the price was right for all above. I guess if you are not planning to spend much time in the Hotel it might be very economical decision to stay there as lots of other places in Singapore are very VERY pricy.

Reviews.Title: “So so Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gunawanto
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for only a night for my biz trip. The hotel is virtually old hotel but clean. It is far to Orchard Road but it is good if you like to exercise by walking to it. Breakfast is so so...room is very big but old design and you can smell old stuffs once you get in to the room. Taxi is not easy to get although the concierge has already put a signal for taxi to come. What I can conclude this is a so so hotel for everything but at least it is a safe hotel.....

Reviews.Title: “Very Average 3 Star”
Reviews.Author: travelguyandgirl26
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Royal Singapore for 4 nights with my mother and we were extremely disappointed with our stay. Our room on the 13th floor was very run down - it had a horrible musty smell, the carpet was frayed, the towels and bath maths were torn, the bedsheets looked dirty, and the two chairs in the room were SO dirty, we didn't even want to sit on them!! Housekeeping was the worst - they couldn't even make the beds properly! We had to complain that they hadn't even swept the bathroom floor, and even after complaining they didn't do it! We also asked them to change the chairs in our room so that we could have a place to sit apart from the bed (!!) and they didn't do that either. Breakfast was extremely average - the breakfast area is very small and with so many guests, it takes forever to get your food! Most of the food was cold and there were ants in the danish pastries!! The *only* good thing about this hotel is it's location - it's about a 7-10 minute walk to the Novena MRT and there is a bus stop right outside the hotel, and it's also close by to some malls. I would never ever recommend this hotel to anyone, - my mom and I were depressed to come back to the hotel every evening! We paid WAY too much for such a run down place.

Reviews.Title: “A big disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: AdminGirl S
Reviews.Content: We booked 5 rooms for 10 company guests from Indonesia in this hotel. When we went there to accompany them for check-in, we had to wait for 2 hours before our guests were able to get their rooms. From their feedback, our guests had a disappointing stay in this hotel. Breakfast for 2 days always delayed and they feel they had to fight for the food everytime! Rooms are very small and dirty. We had expected them to be a bit large and clean based on the pictures in the internet. Service is quite lousy! We are quite embarrassed as we had believed that this hotel can make our guests' stay in Singapore relaxing and comfortable. We will never use this hotel again for our visitors coming in from overseas!

Reviews.Title: “'Royal' visit to Singapore.”
Reviews.Author: Vernon P
Reviews.Content: *This is based on a first visit to Singapore. *If you've had a long flight, relax and grab a taxi from the airport, (S$26). *I arrived at the hotel at 9 a.m. and, as anticipated, my room was not ready (3 p.m. check-in). Friendly and helpful staff advised me it would be ready for 12. I returned after an enjoyable breakfast and walk in the surrounding area at 11 a.m. My room was ready!!! *Baggage can be left securely at reception with attentive staff. *I found all relevant staff friendly, efficient and helpful. *In-house Trishaw Coffee house great for breakfast. Let the staff know if you are self-serve or table service. I had table service because I wanted to try the Nasi Goreng (a rice dish).The meal and 2 coffees cost less than S$20. *My room, 823, is accessible by an efficient 3 lifts system. The room was certainly spacious and comfortable. If you like exercise, jog around the bed a few times!!! Furniture and fittings are suitable, with a few "tatty edges" which in some ways can add to the experience rather than detract. *Importantly, the room was clean. *I don't watch TV on holiday, but there is a large screen TV in the room. *Bathroom is clean and suitable. The shower 'blasts' so is very invigourating. *AirCon is comfortable unless you prefer the "arctic blasts" sometimes provided in Florida hotels. *There is a safe, minifridge, hairdrier and spacious wardrobe but little drawer space and no iron. *Big bonus for Brits - same electrical provision as home - no adapters needed. For other travellers, take a British adapter. *Tipping isn't a big deal, yet, but is becoming more evident and is appreciated rather than expected. *For a first night experience, and if you like walking, Stroll down Newton Road and Scotts Road soaking up the atmosphere until you hit Orchard Road. Be prepared to be hit by an eclectic mix of Upmarket right through to the other extreme. I did this at 8p.m. on a Tuesday, so it is safe walking at night and people were very friendly in the hustle and bustle of Orchard Street. At night it reminded me of a cross between London's Oxford St./ Piccadilly and Times Square. I ate at a Chinese pavement eatery on Bras Basah Road and strolled back to DHOBY GHOUT SRT station at 10,30 p.m. where easy and efficient underground travel took me from D.G. (which is NS24 on the red north/south line) north towards JURONG EAST and 3 stops to NEWTON (NS21). Cost S$2. 10. A 5 minute stroll and you're back at the hotel. *Singapore is dominantly English speaking with a great mix of Western and Asian cultures. *Exchange a S$10 note for some loose change at reception on arrival, certainly if you intend to use any public transport. Always try to keep some loose change at all times. *Singapore has a great public transport system with a bus stop immediately outside the hotel and the underground station only a 5 minute walk away. *People pride themselves on personal and environmental cleanliness. *Go to Marina Bay before dusk and stroll around the footpath (3.5 km) as dusk turns to darkness. There is a lights/lasers/music/water feature display from Marina Bay Sand which has a great view from the Fullerton side. Your camera finger will be burning!! *If you intend to take the cable car to Sentosa ( I would recommend it), it is S$26 return from Tower 1 outside HARBOUR FRONT (SRT) exit. Finding the Ticket Office can be confusing so head for Tower 1, turn left and go clockwise around the building until you reach the Ticket Office.

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant!!”
Reviews.Author: R S
Reviews.Content: Not a pleasant stay at all!! The staff wasn't helpful, the room was old, smelly and pretty dirty (dust, hair and stains). The bathroom was really old and there was hair inside the bath. Not a good location. I would not recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: SydneyChin_Chin
Reviews.Content: Location is great and accessible to MRT- however, rooms are desperately looking for a refurbishment- so boring and tired and housekeeping very poor - run down furniture, uncomfortabe bed, breakfast buffet so primitive and 1950;s food being served. For a hotel in Singapore, you can do much better- provided early check in which was great

Reviews.Title: “Rooms In Bad Need Of Refurbishment!”
Reviews.Author: strawberrychocs
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in December. Hotel is centrally located near 2 shopping centres, bus stops and train station. For the location, this hotel is unfortunately, not up to standard. Hotel rooms are spacious but in bad need of refurbishment. Upon check-in, we found that the room had not been cleaned - there were bits of dried noodles all over the floor, and a room service tray with used cutlery/crockery outside, which stayed there the whole afternoon/night long. I called reception to ask that the room be vacummed, was told "OK", but no one bothered coming to clean up at all! Entrance of hotel has a steep, narrow ramp right in the middle of the stair area, with no clear sign near the ramp to warn people of it. We saw 2 hotel staff struggling to push/pull a load of luggage up the ramp (really bad OH&S issue here). My good pair of tweezers mysteriously vanished after housekeeping cleaned up, after our 1st nights stay, and a complaint made to reception brought a luke warm "i'll check with housekeeping" from the obviously uninterested staff whom I spoke to! Will not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good standard Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1937Max
Reviews.Content: A standard quality good hotel located in a pleasant street a short walk (in the heat) to Novena MRT Station and shopping centre. Stayed there on a Singapore Airlines stopover package. Bus stop at hotel entrance, but could not get information about fares and destinations from reception. Good rooms and breakfast acceptable. Late check out was readily given at no extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad if you don't spend time on it...”
Reviews.Author: Jorgepab
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well placed, near newton and septima station, and most important, near a really touristic and nice area that is the newton hawker centre (food) and near orchad road. The hotel doesn't have much to highlight, quite normal, with big beds, big bedrooms, a bit old fashion and normal stuff (although sometimes we couldn't understand each other). The breakfast is ok, although the staff there is quite nice though.... The most annoying thing of the hotel is the club downstaris that seems a typical singaporean 'karaoke' where business mans meet some 'local' chicks... although that's mainly the impresion that I received. Well communicated and cheap fares by cab from the centre. Recommended if you haven't got a family and don't plan to spend much time on it.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Johnnyjohnny3
Reviews.Content: Very convenient , near orchard shopping center,easy access to MRT station ,the staff are very helpful and can speak english quite well, the room is very spacious for 2 person, clean and the aircon is excellent,very quiet at night time and I can 100% recommend to those would like to stay for a short time, definitely will be back in few months time and stay in the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “ok for a stop over”
Reviews.Author: pamandDRJ
Reviews.Content: This hotel was provided by a travel agent as a stop over. Three rooms were used for one night stay, and while I did not see the others, our was a grand suite. Beautiful bed which we never used,as we wanted a city tour instead of sleep. Clean bath with deep tub and also shower. Good food, lavish breakfast. I have no idea the price, and can't comment on sleep quality. But what a beautiful city!

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: Singaporehotel255060
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very run down and not what appears in the photo's. The majority of the guests are large tour groups. It is not walking distance to anything and no suitable eating places near by. The bedroom was not clean, with the sheets needing replacing about 10 years ago.We were woken on the first morning to major construction work happening on Level 16 which they did not tell us about. I think you could get better value for money staying near the Singapore River. Would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “OK as a "Stop Over" Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NewieTraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not selected by us for our Singapore "stop over" but was included as part of our Sydney to Singapore to London air journey. The reviews where mixed on Trip Advisor, what we found was that the Hotel is an older property, it is clean and the staff friendly with a extensive buffet breakfast offering. If your are looking for a great location, close to Orchard Road, modern property then you will be disappointed, HOWEVER if you require a clean hotel for an overnight stay in Singapore to break up your journey at reasonable price then this hotel will meeet those requirements. The positives we found was Reception staff that were friendly and efficient, had us checked in with no problems and our request for a queensize bed with non-smoking room was meet. We caught taxis to Clarke Quay and it only cost about 7.00 Singapore dollars and to Orchard Road even less. I noticed that a couple reviews said you could walk to Orchard Road, yes you could but it is not a short distance and unless you are fit and prepared to walk in hot humid climate and end up sweaty for your shopping then MRT or taxi is the best option. The Breakfast Buffet was very good and quality good, yes you can get cheaper breakfasts if you travel to Shopping Centres but if you don't want to have to wait for breaky then this is quite acceptable food. Would I stay here again, yes if it was just for an over night stay, would it be my first choice no way but if it was allocated as part of a package it wouldn't worry me for a one night stay but any longer than that there are better hotels in better locations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with Amazing Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Vacation888
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived there, we were slightly taken back because the whole place looked so 80's. Check-in was fast, although not much smile on the receptionist face. Upon entering our room, it's not that bad afterall. They refurbished the toilet quite nicely and very clean, complete with toiletries. Room was spacious! It's like paying for a budget hotel but getting a strong 3 stars hotel quality. Well, mattress was a little too soft but that didn't bother us much since we are out most of the time. The location is near a shopping mall (about 5-7 mins walk) where there's mrt station beneath it, super convenient to go around S'pore. We got a good deal for our stay with inclusive breakfast. Decent spread of asian & western cuisine, most importantly, tasted nice! If you are not too fussy about the old furniture smell (bedsheets are clean though), I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel Accomadation”
Reviews.Author: rayking102
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel a little early and were informed to leave our luggage in a secure area and were guided to the local eateries to have a snack whilst our room was being prepared, we arrived back at the appointed time checked in and were shown to our room, which was adequate for the two of us. The bed was comfy the bathroom clean and there was sufficient room to move around. Breakfast was a mix of asian and western food and was good. We stayed 8 days here and are planning to stay again next time we visit S/pore.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: greenguy213
Reviews.Content: just 3 or 4 bus stops to Orchard road, internet was too expensive, clean toilet, buffet breakfast was good, make sure no construction is goin on around since it can be very noisy. dont expect a personal service or such cos its a city hotel and staff were like robots overall a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Only good thing is close to Novena MRT Station”
Reviews.Author: Hoteladdict2012
Reviews.Content: Hotel is generally old and is in need for refurbishment. Close to novena mrt station, UE Square and Novena Square. Room is old and require renovation. Even though I prefer posh 1980s/1990s classical furniture compared to modern and swanky ones. I like the traditional chiese theme furniture but I wasn't expecting it to be broken and spoilt! Room is not soundproof as I can hear the guests in the room beside me talking loudly. Got a room on 13th floor facing the back of the hotel where it is more quieter compared to facing the main street. Small swmming pool that doesn't provide much space to swim about and the gym is just a small room with a threadmill, cycle machine and muscle toner inside. Quite pathetic and not value for money considering I paid S$230 for it. Breakfast doesn't have much choice and it is always crowed and noisy with china tour groups. Only good thing is it is close to novena mrt station. Checking in requires me to wait for 15 minutes as the check in counter also serve as information counter for other guests asking for directions. Checking out was less than 5 minutes but the hotel staff doesn't smile much despite saying thank you to me. It's like not sincere at all. I rather stay at Changi Village hotel for the price I paid but that is another story.

Reviews.Title: “Got itchy and suffered a week”
Reviews.Author: hong77
Reviews.Content: I slpt just one nite, woke up with whole body on rashes. And the rashes stayed on for a week. Couple of doctors and many of medications. Ad unhappy moments.

Reviews.Title: “Good reasonably priced hotel near Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: crocnsw
Reviews.Content: Second time this year I have stayed at this hotel. Staff are friendly. Room was clean. Many guests but no delays in checking out as front office staff very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “This is one of the safest hotels i have ever come across.”
Reviews.Author: Judds09
Reviews.Content: I complained about the furniture being torn and the bathroom being dirty - hair all over the bath and the shower recess so dirty you couldn't see through it. There was no internet in the room unless you paid a $50 sing deposit on top of the $8per hour you already had to pay. On top of this I was charged $300 sing for the privilege on the guise that this was a self rated 4 star hotel from motif. Upon complaining to both Wotif I was told it was beyond their control. Upon complaining to the hotel I was sent a poor bell boy to deal with my issues. When I called management I was told that the duty manage had gone awol. I insisted so a teenager from the front desk was sent to talk to me. She nodded and offered me another room with exactly the same problems i.e. dirty bathroom, torn furniture,etc. Utterly depressing and worst thing about the place was the complete indifference.

Reviews.Title: “convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: md_traveler31
Reviews.Content: at first, i was hesitant to stay at this hotel due to its bad reviews. but when i got there, it was ok. yet a bit old, it's a cozy hotel. the staff are not strict. yes, you carry your own bags to the room but it was fine. (did not have to give tips) hehehe..... the location was very convenient. it's near a mall, a grocery store, a 5 min drive to orchard and little india. just don't have big expectations. it really is not a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed - I would never stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: LeahSydney01
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at this hotel as part of a stopover package which was included in an airfare to Europe. I was not impressed by this hotel. The check-in was slow compared to other hotels that we have stayed in, in Singapore and elsewhere. I chose this hotel (out of a list of 5 hotels offered by the airline) because it is advertised as having a swimming pool. Upon arrival, however, we were told that the pool was closed "indefinately". This was in late June 2011 - I do not know if it has since been re-opened. The air conditioning vent in one of our rooms leaked. There were no towels provided in the bathrooms - I had to call housekeeping to request some. There was also no plug in the bath - again, I had to call housekeeping to obtain one. We could hear loud plumbing noises when water was used in the adjacent rooms. I saw the advertised rack rates at Reception and have no doubt that you could easily find better value for money accommodation elsewhere in Singapore (as we did on our return journey). i would also strongly advise against using their 'busines centre'. I tried to use it to do an internet check-in and it took me almost an hour to do what I could have done elsewhere in under 5 minutes. There is basically no printing capability and their computers are extremely slow. All in all, a very frustrating experience! Ona positive note, we thought that the breakfast buffet was good quality and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Room”
Reviews.Author: jmchin
Reviews.Content: Room was dirty and old. The room also smelled bad. It needs a renovation.

Reviews.Title: “A farce”
Reviews.Author: MrsK96
Reviews.Content: I booked this hoTel off the airasia website.I am very disappointed that the airline is promoting such a hotel.Its location is not too bad, a walk frm Novena Station.However, the hotel requires a major revamp! I paid a packet for one family room that only sleeps three persons when I specifically required a room that sleeps five. In hindsight I could have got two rooms at a better hotel for the same price! With the bad reviews on this hotel I decided to double book and ended up only spending a sinlge night here instead of three nights. This was a good decision. THIS HOTEL IS A NO NO!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel staff close to centre of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: crocnsw
Reviews.Content: With trepidation booked this hotel after reading several reveiws by unhappy guests. I found the hotel staff to be friendly and helpful and the rooms clean although a little dated. Hotel is close to main shopping centres but a taxi is needed for the short ride to Orchard Road. Hotel has closed the bars on the upper floor so no noise problem at all. A short walk from the hotel are four local bars with friendly owners. Will stay at the hotel again. However there are several hotels in Singapore with the name "Royal" in it. Be specific which one you want if using a taxi as it is possible to have a tour visiting the hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good stopover Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BevGloucs
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights en-route to Oz. Good, comfortable, clean Hotel. Walking distance to Orchard road.

Reviews.Title: “Dated accomodation, poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: gillbla
Reviews.Content: The room was clean but looked very tired and dated. There was no smoe detector and not free water, which is unusual in singapore. Receptionists had to be asked when breakfast was and then they had to check - surely this is the first thing you are normally told. Fruit at breakfast wasn't ripe and only cereal was very sugary. The more native options also looked rather greasy. Massive building site behind too, so weekdays are very noisy

Reviews.Title: “No value for money”
Reviews.Author: Jufri64
Reviews.Content: Noisy rooms , with KTV lounge on 16 floor and 2nd floor I think. The lift and the lobby was always attended by foreign Chinese and Vietnamese girls. Not a Comfortable sight when people with families staying in the hotel. Room was pretty old, carpet stinks , Definetly require refurbishment. Too expensive , And no value for money. Location well located near to Orchard.

Reviews.Title: “No frills but moderately good enough”
Reviews.Author: littlecygnus
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1) Check in & out was quite quick (perhaps because we booked through a travel agent). 2) Staff was alright, well mostly. 3) Room was clean and spacious 4) Room facilities: iron with ironing board were provided in the cupboard as well as an umbrella (which is thoughtful considering the weather in Singapore), a telephone, a small fridge, a TV, an electric kettle, and a hairdryer in the bathroom. 5) There was also a digital safe box in the room. 6) Hot and cold water were working perfectly. 7) Fresh towels everyday and bed was comfy. 8) There was a tour agent office in the hotel (near the receptionist). 9) Hotel had a gym and a swimming pool (we didn't use it though because of limited time of stay). 10) There was a bus stop in front of the hotel for easy commute to the city. Shuttle bus to Orchard road was cheap though. Cons: 1) Air-conditioning was not really properly working - it was hot. After we phoned to complain, somebody came to fix it. But it was still hot! We called and complained again, and then they changed our room after 15 minutes or so (that was good!). 2) House keeping was everyday so if you don't like it, don't forget to press the 'do not disturb' sign in the room. 3) No complimentary water! Make sure you bring some bottled water in your luggage since mineral water is expensive in Singapore. 4) Food - pricey so we didn't eat there. It was also because the staffs in the cafeteria were not friendly and never smile at all when we first came in. 5) Location - Prepare to walk! If you don't mind walking, nearest shop is about 12 - 15 minutes walk. 6) No free wi-fi. There was a small cyber-room that you could use for internet (next to receptionist). I didn't remember how much you have to pay per hour though.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & great location”
Reviews.Author: maysie
Reviews.Content: I was rather apprehensive about this hotel after reading all the bad reviews but could not resist a good offer given by a travel website. In the end, I was pleased to find my fears unfounded. The hotel might be old but the rooms were comfortable & clean for a good night's sleep. Most importantly, the location was great : a bus-stop at its doorstep & walking distance to two MRT stations, shopping malls & the popular Newton Food Centre. You could even walk to Orchard Road if you want to (half an hour's walk) ! Staff was courteous & helpful; but as some of them are foreigners, communications can be a bit confusing at times. Checking in was a breeze - we were given our rooms immediately despite arriving few hours early. There was some noise from the traffic at night & ours rooms were on the 14th floor - one floor below the night club - so, light sleepers, be warned. We were usually too exhausted by the end of the day to let anything shake us from our slumber! The buffet breakfast spread was limited & pretty much the same everyday but enough to satisfy both Asian's & Westerner's palates. The only grouse was that the coffee house was too small - getting a table can be a problem - you might have to share a table or else, go earlier around 8 am to beat the breakfast crowd. All in all, Hotel Royal is a comfortable & conveniently located hotel for a holiday in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “hotel recetionists specially novi and gracey are very accommodating.practical place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: bing67
Reviews.Content: at the reception pls.look for novi or gracey,they are very accommodating..everyday,room is being cleaned, linens and towels are ,changed everyday...a practical place to stay...

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel: Room for Improvement”
Reviews.Author: kshameer
Reviews.Content: I didn't do much at the hotel, I used to go early for my work and came back to the hotel to sleep. Obviously if you go to a city like Singapore you will be a fool if you are there to stay and enjoy just the amenities of the hotel, which obviously you can do it anywhere. So I rate this hotel as an average place of stay with good comfort for sleeping. Service orientation as such is poor, a lot to do in regards to upgrading the facilities obviously, but on the reasonable side the location is not too bad, you can get to the airport in 20 mins, and the city center in 15. Not a bad choice if sleeping is all you do at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A BIG NO!”
Reviews.Author: ChicksterWowo
Reviews.Content: I searched for a room that can accomodate for 3 adults and 2 children on airasiago.com, and this hotel was the only result. I booked for 2 nights and paid in advance. It said the price includes breakfast but didn't say for how many people, so I assumed it was for 3 adults and 2 children, as the guest names are all written on the booking confirmation. But we only got breakfast for 3 persons. When we check-in, we had to wait for nearly an hour. They said they're still cleaning the room. We checked in at 12.45 pm local time while on the itinerary it's said the check-in time is 1pm. I booked in July so it didn't make sense to me that the room was not ready yet. The room was small, with a single bed and a queen bed! They called it 'family room'!!! It's humid with filthy carpet. Seems like they never vacum-cleaned the room for ages! The AC was leaked, and the bathroom was tiny. The staff in the restaurant (trishaw coffeshop) was not friendly at all)! The location is not comfortable for families with smal children. The nearest MRT station is 10mins walk so we always took taxi. Overall, this hotel disappointed me.

Reviews.Title: “Stay anywhere but here!”
Reviews.Author: phillipsly
Reviews.Content: It felt like a quest, not a stay. My booking was paid in advance with Agoda for 2 nights, which was 2 night to long in this place. After the checking in had taken over 45minutes they totally refused to give me the room key until I had paid Sing $50 for the mini-bar and pointed me to an ATM with a 20 minutes walk! My request was for a non smoking room with a big double bed. What i got was a smoking room with a two tiny twin beds designed for midgets AFTER I HANDED OVER THEIR $50. When I complained they pretended not to understand English until I shouted, then everything became clear real quick. Under duress they move me to the room I requested, but with no mini-bar (bang goes the SG$50), not even a small cheap bottle of complementary drinking water! Internet costs S$10 for three hours straight, you cannot log-in and out, actually we couldnt even log-in. They call the "technician"in Hong Kong (yeah right) and charge the call to my room! Still didnt work. The bath towels looked like a dog had a litter of pups on them, stained and ripped to pieces. The staff were so rude I cannot describe how bad they are, but i understand why gun laws are so strict in SG as this hotel would have no reception, duty manager, pc techie guy or house cleaning. You know how people over react and embellish the truth? Well, I invite you to test me and see for your self with this hotel. Or you could just stay somewhere else and avoid this festering hole.

Reviews.Title: “Renovation needed ASAP”
Reviews.Author: SFOtravelguy
Reviews.Content: Curbside Impression: Stuck in the 80s. Check in/out: Staff was courteous and helpful Room: The minute we walked into our room, it reeked of cigarette smoke. The room was constantly humid and the A/C did nothing but circulated the smoky smell inside the room. Since the humidity was so high, I quickly pulled the bedsheets off to check for bed bugs, fortunately, I found none, but did spot quite a few pubic hair. I felt so uncomfortable, I slept in long sleeves to add another layer between myself and the mattress. The carpet looked and felt dirty. kept our slippers on 24/7. Bathroom: The worst part of the room was the bathroom, it reeked of mildew. In fact, it smelled like the inside of an old Chinese dim sum restaurant. Black stains along the bath tub and after every shower, no matter how careful you are, we ended up with a big puddle of water in the middle of the bathroom floor. We hated our bathroom so much that we tried to go as many times as possible when we were in nice shopping malls to avoid using our own. Breakfast: Good selection of Asian and some western food. Location: OK if you don't mind a 8-10 mins walk from the nearest subway stop. Easy bus stop out front for connection to all major tourist attractions. Verdict: Go somewhere else, unless you have no other choice, or until they renovate the property.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel in nice area”
Reviews.Author: taliababe
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights at the end of July 2010. We had to have 2 rooms as they didn't seem to have family rooms or rooms for 2 adults and 2 children which is a pity and made it very expensive. However they did give us adjoining rooms, although not the promised upgrade that we were entitled too, and when I asked for a late check out, we were allowed an extra hour although the hotel wasn't busy (again this were supposed to be part of our booking). The furniture in the rooms was old fashioned but it was fine and the rooms were clean and quiet. The fridge was empty and you could have a mini bar on request which we thought was a great idea. Didn't use the restaurants as very expensive and plenty of food places nearby. Pool was quite small but underutilised so no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: Salamano
Reviews.Content: From the first impression you can already tell this Hotel is not really presentable. Reception is small, everything is a bit worn out and the arrangement of VIP Rooms, Restaurants, breakfast room quite confusing. The room, it was an upgrade, still disappointing. They "added" a small room, furnished it with a sofa a table and a tv, no carpet but lamination... more like a waiting area at a low tier dentist. Worst thing, even if common in southeast asia: the frowst. Like mildew... Air con is leaking, windows don't really close and at the same time can't be opened. And it's loud outside... Breakfast is a torture. Especially if you are not a morning person you will like the crowded and loud cantine atmosphere.. no corner to hide. A picture on the wall, or a lamp on the desk would be helpful if you wanted to work in the evenings... New bedclothes would be nicer to sleep in then the worn out ones...And if you are the kind of person who likes to have ensured nightlife amusement in your hotel instead of going out and try your luck, you might make use of the nightclub, the KTV, or the "Vip-Room"... Well what's positive? Staff is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday trip to Singapore”
Reviews.Author: KaranIsCool
Reviews.Content: We went to Singapore last year around April 2009 for 5 days for our honeymoon. We booked the room in Hotel Royal for 5 days. The weather was fine during the month of April. t is located on Newton road, very close to Orchard road and the rooms are beautiful and nice and clean. Entering the hotel area, there is a beautiful little pond with the golden fishes. We used to go to Orchard road by local transport bus. Commuting is quick in Singapore and metro is the best medium of travel. The hotel has a nice restaurant and the buffet is served all three time. But we only pick the breakfast buffet. They serve american, english, indian and european food styles. Inside the room, a nice little fridge is present and loaded with cans of beer and other beverages. The cans in the fridge are not free. The bathrooms are pretty nice and have showers. They also have a digital safe inside the wardrobe to keep the valuables. There are pubs and nearby markets near the hotel. The nearest metro station is Novena square and it is around 15 mins walk from the hotel. Inside the hotel there are some shops also, and i bought the local mobile SIM and some post cards. The famous local mobile network is Singtel. Overall i like the hotel and would definitely visit again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “THE VALUE HOTEL IN SINGAPORE”
Reviews.Author: clearbeer
Reviews.Content: As an airline pilot I live in Hotels! This one is fantastic value . The breakfast alone is worth the stay. The 24 hour coffee shop really is 24 hours and serves beer etc. The bars are good as is the shop. It takes about 4 mins to walk to Novena MRT and buses and taxis are nearly always available outside hotel . An added bonus is the availability of a tour operator in the lobby. The staff were all friendly and the facilities and rooms clean Will go again.

Reviews.Title: “In need of a make over”
Reviews.Author: DSDS1
Reviews.Content: Firstly, our expectations weren't really high as this hotel, by Singapore's standards, is quite affordable. It is located about 25 minute walk from Orchard Road, bus right out the front and Novena Station and shopping 5 minutes away. So I thought the location was alright. My main complaint was the breakfast. Its served in a room that just doesn't cope with the number of guests and the food is pretty awful. Perhaps it is more to aimed at Asian tastes - we tended to stick to toast and jam and even then, the bread was below par. The rooms are good size but our two rooms were in need of a make over. Water leaked from fridge and A/C, shower over bath and very slippery, both safes needed attention, wallpaper peeling, stool wonky and unsafe to sit on. All pretty small things but they do add up. Also this hotel tends to attract a lot of young children - if you don't enjoy screaming children running up and down corridors, avoid! And the corridors smelt of stale cigarette smoke. So the cons outweighed the pros - I think this hotel could be quite good with a bit of TLC. I did find the staff to be quite good and they fixed the safes quickly. Checking in was quite smooth as was checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Mikewhillis
Reviews.Content: The first disappointment was the location. The nearest convenience store, to stock the always overpriced mini bar was a sweltering 10 minute walk away. The location was redeemed by a bus stop outside which linked to the excellent underground transit system. Also the Newton Court hawker centre was a 5 minutes bus ride away. The room was of a good size, although this was a travel agent upgrade so I cannot speak for the standard rooms. The furniture was "tired" and the shower little short of pathetic. It was a mere trickle and on two out of three mornings luke warm at 8.30. Breakfast was adequate, the standard of food acceptable but with the choice of freshly cooked eggs. However on the first morning the toaster went up in blue flash, blowing the electrics. There was a great deal of staff running around like headless chickens and eventually the toaster being removed but not replaced. All good cabaret but not satisfactory if you like toast for breakfast. On checkout we had a late flight and asked for an airport shuttle to be booked for 9.30pm. I asked about this twice and was told that it would be no problembut it could only be booked 2 hours before required. I went out for a meal returning at 8.30pm to be told that the shuttle was full and not available. The alternative was a taxi. As it happens the taxi turned out to be a cheaper alternative and also quicker. So a tip here is use a taxi not the shuttle. Aside from this the staff were in general freindly and attentive but the overall impression was of a hotel that needed a change of management to shake it out of its topor and bring it into the 21st century.

Reviews.Title: “A dissappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: LACUk
Reviews.Content: The staff were always busy but relatively helpful. Hotel badly needs refurbishing and everything looked stained and gruby in the rooms and in public areas. The breakfast was something to be desired and nothing to look forward to. We were led to believe that the hotel was near the shopping district of Orchard Road but was nowhere near and the only way to be comfortable due to the heat and humidity would be to go by taxi as the walk to the Orchard Road took a long time. With hindsight think we could have got a hotel for the same price which was a lot more comfortable and more central.

Reviews.Title: “second rate compared with others”
Reviews.Author: JohnSFleet_Hants_UK
Reviews.Content: this hotel was not as conveniently located as described, being somewhat remote for major attractions. very much a 3 star hotel, clean and efficient but not overly splendid; food OK and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: iandorothy
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews which were not positive we were pleasantly surprised. Although the hotel is definitely in need of modernisation the rooms were large, clean and appeared to have been recently decorated. The staff were pleasant and helpful. The hotel is away from the centres but taxis are not expensive and the underground is only a 10 minute walk

Reviews.Title: “Good location.. rooms not so good”
Reviews.Author: SaraJohn12
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location. It's in a good area. For the same price you can get a better hotel in a bad place.. From there, you have easy access to the rest of the city. There's a bus stop in front of the hotel and the MRT is a few minutes away. There are 2 malls near the hotel where you can find pretty much anything. The rooms are large and clean but they need renovation. The furniture looks very old. The white curtains are gray.. It's not pretty at all. Most of the staff is very nice. When you stay for a long time, they give you some gifts. The breakfast is very good.. they have all kinds of food there. Local and western choices. There were fruits, juices and breads as well as the local food. The internet is pretty slow and disconnects all the time, but I guess it depends on the room you're staying.. People from other rooms said it worked well. If it weren't for the ugly rooms it would be a very good hotel to stay and also, it´s cheaper than those in Rivervalley and Orchard.

Reviews.Title: “Formula 1 trip”
Reviews.Author: PhillipC2
Reviews.Content: Breaky was great, different but great. Always wiling to help out where we wanted to go for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: TravellingSandgroper
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a short walk to Novena MRT station, with a bus stop right in front of the hotel. It's close to United Square and Velocity shopping malls, and close enough to walk to Newton Circus Food Centre. We needed four non-smoking rooms and they were able to accommodate us quite quickly on the 9th floor. You get what you pay for, and at ~AUD$110 per night per room, this was good value. The rooms were pretty large and, although a little dated, the rooms were cleaned daily by very friendly housekeeping staff. As a bonus, the rooms have their own safes. The only time I felt ripped off was when I had to pay twice for the Internet kiosk on the 4th floor. I put my money in and it wouldn't work. I had to pay again and luckily for me it started up. Another down side was the leaky shower area. During a shower, the water leaks and runs onto the floor near and around the toilet. My criteria for a good stay are: 1) close enough to walk to MRT, 2) no insects, 3) clean rooms. The proximity to the MRT and the clean enough rooms made this, in my opinion, very good valur for money. At this price, I know I am not going to get 5-star luxury, so as long as the place is clean enough, then that is fine. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “MOst Horrable hotel to visit”
Reviews.Author: momo094
Reviews.Content: If you are planning a trip to sangapore, stay away from this hotel. It is dirty. Staff is very unprofessional Many cmplaints about this hotel not honering your reservation. They try to charge you more Dont jeopardize your vacation by statying at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of pros and plenty of cons”
Reviews.Author: aycs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Royal from the 7th of November to the 24th of November. We arrived at 6am and were offered a non-smoking room (as requested) room straight away, but we decided to wait till 9.30 for a double bed, rather than accepting the twin single. Service throughout our stay was fine and housekeeping were all friendly and happy to help with extra towels when asked. The rooms were a good size and although the furniture was old, the tv had 30 odds channels, although not all of them had a signal and the bath was so high that it was sometimes a struggle to climb out of the tub after a shower. There was no bedside clock, and the air-conditioning seemed fine and kept the room cool. Our rooms did not have an ironing board or an iron, but there was one located in the laundry. The bathroom smelled very musty and there were mould spots on the shower curtain, and there was always water in the grout from when housekeeping would clean the place. Our basin was also cracked, which led to very small amounts of water dripping onto the tiles below. The bed wasn't exactly the most comfortable and the sheets were a little scratchy for my liking, but all that was acceptable to us because we knew that we were not staying at a 5 star hotel. There is a laundry on the 4th floor, along with a couple of coin operated computers ($2 for 15 minutes). It's not exactly fast and there were issues of the slots swallowing your money and not giving you your time, so use them at your own peril. There was no music or noise issues, except for noisy guests returning late at night and slamming the door shut, or talking loudly as they go past your room. We were on the 9th floor and only 2 doors from the elevator and the only time we heard music coming from either the club upstairs or the karaoke lounge downstairs (not sure which one) was the morning we checked in (about 10am) when we were trying to get some sleep after a red eye flight. We used the tour booking office to book a tour to Malacca and although we got what we needed, the tour operator always seemed very busy and did not go into detail much unless he was asked direct questions. What was a nice touch from the hotel was after staying a week, we were left a small fruit platter and after staying about 2 weeks, some of our party were given a small gift of biscuits. Those of us that did not get our rooms cleaned on that day didn't get anything. The hotel is located only a 8 minute casual walk from the MRT station, but there is also a bus stop located right outside the hotel (which we used frequently) that can take you to Orchard Road and right around the island. Plenty of taxis go past the hotel because it is located on busy Newton road. There are three shopping centres at the MRT station and plenty of eateries (including Starbucks) where you can get your meals rather than eating at the hotel. Walking in the other direction for 10 minutes will take you to Newton Circus, where you can get yourself dinner or a late night supper. The only big negatives seem to happen to the others that were travelling in our party. My sister had someone come into her room late one night because the staff had accidentally given him 'her' room, instead on the room two floors above. Fortunately were all were gathered in my sister's room at that moment for a late night drink and chat, so the look on that poor traveller's face when he opened the door and found us all sitting there was priceless. From a security point of view, it's not a laughing matter though. My parents stayed in a room diagonals from us and they had problems of water leaking on their backs whilst there were using the toilet. The problem was fixed that day, but it's still a gross thought and would have been a distraction no doubt when you're supposed to be sitting on the toilet focusing on something more important. My brother and his girlfriend's room was across from us and they returned to their room one night to find a huge (I know we all tend to exaggerate, but this one was huge) spider in the corner of their roof. Someone came to try and remove it unsuccessfully, so my brother and his girlfriend decided to squash it against the roof (using the tools from the maintenance guy), killing it and leaving a nice smear mark for the rest of their stay. The last of our party arrived a week after we did, and although he wasn't able to get a non-smoking room (on our floor), his smoking room did not have any overpowering smell of cigarettes, so after unsuccessfully trying to get a room on our floor after 2 nights, he decided to stay put for the rest of his stay. Paying what we paid, you can probably get a better hotel in a slightly better location, but at the time of our booking, it was a cheap hotel (we were staying nearly 3 weeks). Would I stay there again? Depends on the price and the current exchange rate, but probably not.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE STAY ... Even for $1”
Reviews.Author: TechMarauder
Reviews.Content: Listen, I booked the Singapore Stopover for US$1, so I know you get what you pay for, but I can get a better room at a US Motel 6 than this place. This place was completely dated.. and honestly dirty. The halls and rooms smelled of must and mold. The room had the MOST UNCOMFORTABLE bed I have ever tried to sleep on. At night, there was a karaoke singer on the 3rd floor singing until 1am... and the sound resonated all the way to the 13th floor... besides the fact the glaring "jazz" music near the elevators kept us up anyway. Overall.. I would rather pay $100 and stay at a place I could sleep at. The only positive was that the staff was pleasant - it's not their fault that the hotel is horrible.

Reviews.Title: “No Frills Hotel”
Reviews.Author: banzai0
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of the Singapore Stopover promo. For the price I paid for the room, I should not really complain about the hotel because we do get what we pay for. If I wanted to stay at Ritz-Carlton, then I certainly needed to pay more. The corridors, hallways, and elevators seem to be newly renovated. However, the room I stayed in was really dated and had old wooden furnishings. The TV was an old CRT type with only a few cable channels worth watching. The room did have a ref and a safe. If you are a tall person, you might have problems taking a shower because the shower head in the bathroom is quite low. The Novena MRT station is within walking distance, but I did walk from the hotel going to Orchard Road to see the surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Not really "Royal"”
Reviews.Author: Tanya_Greece
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at the hotel Royal during August. The hotel was very old and though the rooms were spacy, they had a really out of date decoration and very old furniture. The corridors of the hotel smelled a bit weird and the cleaning service was not the best one. Upon our arrival to the room, a person from the staff got into our room and began spraying it while we were inside the room! I suppose it was for insecticide purposes... Nevertheless, it had quite a sympathetic location as it was 5 min walk from the metro station.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant surprise & stay after expecting the worst from reading reviews!! (^_^)”
Reviews.Author: dunkinky
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in Aug'09 and enjoyed the services in particular. We booked from Hotelclub.net with a special of S$129 per night per room. The reception staff were surprisingly helpful & even let us check in early when we arrive(before 8am). This was very much welcomed as we flew the Red-Eye specials overnight to arrive in Spore in the early morning, and were already weary. The staff was also accommodating enough to move us to a quieter & less smokey room in the afternoon when it was available. Only issue with the location is that you need to take a bus from the hotel to go anywhere of interest, or walk 10min to the nearest MRT train station. We were warned by the staff to stay aware from the KTV lounge on the ground floor after dark if you are not into the seedy scene. The room & facilities, while old, were still clean enough. I guess they must have renovated & improved on the conditions since the previous bad reviews. The hotel is still undergoing renovations so noise could be a slight issue. The buffet breakfast, when included, consists of hot & cold food, and looks quite plentiful. We however did not take up that option. There was no complimentary morning newspaper or any stationery (papers, pens, envelope etc) in the room, but the standard tea & coffee-making amenities, including bar fridge are provided. Rooms also provide phones, ironing board etc but no alarm clocks. Overall a very pleasant stay & experience.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff and filthy room - Spoilt a brilliant holiday”
Reviews.Author: wangsbird
Reviews.Content: I was weary of this hotel before travelling, and had expressed concerns to the travel agent. I wish I had been more persuasive and changed hotels. The check in staff were rude and abrupt- barking at us with no manners. Got out of the lift on floor 13 to be met with the stench of stale feet. The corridor was sprawled with trainers, sports kits, an inflatable pool and even a shopping trolley. It reminded me of University Halls. We opened the door to our room, and the smell became a fousty mould smell instead. The carpets had stains on them, the bed linen had black marks. The flipflops provided in the room were vile with remnants of other people's feet so remained untouched. However bad the room was, I was not prepared for the bathroom. Mould all over the grout, broken tiles, mould all round the intermitant bath seal. Brown stains around the toilet including the base and the back of the seat. I wrote "dirty" in the mirror and it was still there 3 days later. The shower curtain was the type you would get from a pound shop, and it too had black marks on it. And the floor was covered in long black hairs- and since I am fair haired, I dread to think how long they have been there. And they too were there the whole duration of our stay.... We had no idea what facilities were in the hotel as there was no information provided. The only thing we saw was a label next to an occasional floor button in the lift.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel like the plague - it might have the plague!”
Reviews.Author: jtv10
Reviews.Content: Pros: location close to Novena Square MRT, clean bathrooms Cons: Bad air quality: musty smell, bacteria in air ducts cause coughing. Stains on carpet and bedspreads. Bad service. Thin walls: can hear other people coughing. Both my husband and I fell sick on our honeymoon from the poor air quality after just 2 days in this hotel. We stayed there because we were supposed to get a special deal since we hosted our wedding banquet at the Jade Room Restaurant, housed inside the hotel. We arrived to find out that they had screwed up and didn't even have us down for a room. It took a long time to straighten things out with the inflexible and unhelpful staff. Instead of getting a honeymoon suite or even a decent queen room, we got stuck with a standard twin room. The carpet and bedspreads were old and had small stains. Then we got sick from the bacteria in the air ducts and spent the rest of the honeymoon coughing. We changed hotels as soon as we could.

Reviews.Title: “shabby”
Reviews.Author: Zing1
Reviews.Content: We broke our flight to Sydney with an overnight stay, both ways, at the Hotel Royal. On the way out, it was OK. Not smart, a bit shabby, but all we wanted was a bed for us, a bed for our 3yr old and a cot for our 1yr old. The cot was broken so we asked for another one and they replaced it straight away. Friendly people. On our return, two weeks later, things didn't go well. The room was not ready when we arrived at 3.30pm and we had to wait over half an hour with exhausted children. They gave us a complimentary drink in the "restaurant", but we quickly found that only coffee or synthetic yuk drinks. Certainly no fresh fruit juice. The room was was OK. The bathroom wasn't particularly clean (dusty, someone else's hair on the hair-dryer base) and the same broken cot in the room, so we complained. We survived, but we won't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Standard hotel in reasonable location”
Reviews.Author: Kevinandhelena
Reviews.Content: Booked through Singapore Airlines Stopover holiday, this hotel is conveniently located for Orchard Rd shopping. Standard large hotel.

Reviews.Title: “CHEAP HOTEL- better options available”
Reviews.Author: wildflowerb
Reviews.Content: I had one night in Singers before heading onwards to Vietnam. I didn't want anything fancy and I didn't get anything fancy. I reckon I paid about $90 for this hotel. When I got there, they gave me a smoking room but it smelt quite bad so had to get this changed. I am an agent so I know I requested Non smoking. They moved me quite happily and I got upgraded to a suite of some description- the room was huge- had 2 single beds- but was just me so no drama. There are no bells and whistles with this hotel. The breakfast is basic yet functional. It's a bed for the night. If you are looking at staying longer in Singapore then try the Peninsular Excelsior- not far from Raffles and is a good value 3*. Not too far from a metro station ( 10 minutes walk??) so accessible to transport. Not my favourite place to stay but hey I didn't pay much for it. You get what you pay for here.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: kristyjs
Reviews.Content: We booked here for two nights, and the room had 1970 furnishings, nothing in the rooms about the hotel or what to do in Singapore, the clerks at the front office, was rather rude and not helpful in any way. We had our two year old with us and so three people in the room and only gave us two towels. Breakfast was powered egg and broiled ham, so not my idea of a good full buffet breakfast. The bath didn't hold any water because the plug was broken, cockroaches if you turned on the light at night and scared them, annoying elevator music played continually all throughout the night and you could hear people coming and going rather easily. It was close to two shopping centres and it was easy to get cabs, but would definately not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you like a brothel on the premises”
Reviews.Author: KiwiDale
Reviews.Content: Lovely frontage however next to reception is a working nightly brothel come bar where woman travelling on their own are not encouraged to use. The ladies take their men past the swimming pool to the car parks to do their business. If you have children do not stay here. No suitable bar in this place however I was told to walk a block down the road as their was a nice english bar where I could get a drink rather than going into the ladies of the night bar adjacent the main reception. I was astonished. Rooms are very dirty however beware looks are very deceiving, pay a tad extra and you will enjoy your place of stay in lovely Singapore. Dale - New Zealand

Reviews.Title: “Intolerable”
Reviews.Author: Toponoetikos
Reviews.Content: I go to Singapore 5-10 times a year, and this is the worst hotel I have ever stayed at in Singapore in 20 years. I booked this room on HotelClub which I have used with great success in the past throughout Asia. In this case it was a terrible mistake. The room smelled horrible, was dirty and stained. Furthermore, and most important, the air conditioning had two settings - on or off. On was way too cold and off was (as expected in a tropical climate) unacceptably hot. The hotel solution was an offer to give me more blankets. I checked out before staying one night and stayed at Traders Hotel at double the price. When I checked out of Hotel Royal, the clerk told me they would bill me for one night. I called Hotelclub and also went online to cancel the reservation. This was to no avail as I later discovered that Hotel Royal invoiced Hotelclub for the full stay. I am still negotiating with Hotelclub, filed a complaint with Hotel Royal and will file a complaint with the Singapore Tourist Board. Mark (Bangkok)

Reviews.Title: “good located, but shabby and not clean”
Reviews.Author: FabioC
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located (5 min walking from metro station of Novena), but it seemed to be shabby. The room had the carpet stained and was not as clean as expected. TV in the room was not working at all. Breakfast quite essential. In some web sites is quoted as 4 stars: ridiculous... For few dollars more you can get much better in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Applewoodnz
Reviews.Content: Read previous reviews but had already booked so hoped for the best and pleasantly surprised. We were only there one night, didn't notice any smoke smells in the room. Breakfast was a good feed. Access to MRT station was convenient so quite happy to stay there again. Malcolm

Reviews.Title: “Okay when part of SIA package”
Reviews.Author: ceresNewZealand
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights as part of the Singapore Airlines package. The room was nice and spacious, we had only booked a double with a baby cot for our daughter, but they gave us a family room with a queen and single bed. So that was a nice surprise. Our room was right next door to the elevator but we didn't hear anything at night time to annoy us. Not much noise in general either as others have commented on. They were very welcoming regarding a late checkout, we stayed in the room till at least 3pm, then stored our luggage, and we then had a swim and shower before leaving at 8.30pm. Novena MRT station is very close as are 2 reasonable sized shopping malls.

Reviews.Title: “location to the great orchard road”
Reviews.Author: teddy28
Reviews.Content: Found good value for money what you expect for the star rating. ate a few times in the restaurant found ok/good.payed $200 for 2 rooms stayed 4 night.very chinese ambience but new year was coming no complaints, we love singapore.sent the girls shopping and hit the bar.Location 4 stops on the bus to orchard road.Location,locationLocation great.

Reviews.Title: “traveller beware!”
Reviews.Author: welovetotravel01
Reviews.Content: We were booked into The Hotel Royal by Singapore Airlines( the best airline in the world?) We were not expecting the Ritz, but we weren't expecting a prostitute in the lobby either. The rooms smelled and the ameneties were less than standard. I don't know who was more disappointed us, or the prostitute that didn't get a "john". Staff were friendly and helpful. Please see the photos or our "deluxe room". The sheets were unfitted, stained and had holes in them. Water pressure was poor, no facecloths, and when asked they didn't have any. If you do stay there, bring your own bedding and facecloths. The location is good; close to the MRT and a shopping mall. The hotel offered 50% off meals in their restaurants; even then the prices were still higher than anywhere else. We just thought we put this out there, as we wouldn't have stayed if the reviews were accurate. Have a look at the photos; if it is OK to you, book in, if it looks as bad as it did to us, look elsewhere. Bring Slippers, you don't want bare anything touching this room.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: Tikus
Reviews.Content: Seeing the poor reviews I feel an update is required. We booked a twin room through Singapore Airlines for US$244 for 3 nights, incld. b'fast and airport transfers. Room: standard with all the expected amenities. Bathroom: clean and normal size. Water pressure good. B'fast very good, great variety: Western, Malay, Indian, Chinese and even a small selection of Yam Cha ( Dim Sum). Staff friendly enough (for S'pore). Tour desk guy terrific! Transport A1!! Bus at door step. 2 bus stops to Newton MRT. Very useful at night when all taxis seem to be "on hire". Internet cafe 2 mins. walk away. Newton Circus hawker stalls 10 mins. walk or 2 bus stops. Never tried the pool, too busy. All in all a pleasant surprise to us after reading the lousy reviews. I'd recommed this hotel to anyone who does not crave 5 * digs.

Reviews.Title: “Just Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Domrcpl
Reviews.Content: I would say that this is a typical budget tourist hotel where you one gets an adequate room with just adequate service. The turnover of tour groups that comes through this hotel must be quite large as it seemed to me that the hotel lobby was always filled with tour groups and their luggage either coming or going. In the evenings, the small lobby's ambience was not helped at all by its Karaoke Bar which had photos of female hostesses posted at the Bar's entrance. The hotel restaurant was again, just adequate in terms of space, service and overall food quality. The one thing going for the hotel is that it is located just a few minutes from a subway stop so that it was easy to get around if the hotel itself is not centrally located. There are also small shopping areas within walking distance. The hotel happened to have been booked for us and was thus not our choice. While we did not have a bad stay, I am quite certain we would choose a different hotel the next time we go to Singapore. However, for budget travelers who just want something adequate, the hotel would do just fine.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: MikeCMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Generally an inexpensive 3 star hotel which is reasonably well located. You need to walk for about 8 min to the Novena MRT station which can get you to town easily. Good Points: Cheap Rooms are good sized for the price you are paying They even provide combs, toothbrush and toothpaste. Not bad for a hotel like this Quite clean The have a pool Service is satisfactory Bad points: Shopping centre not at your doorstep. The elevators are hopeless and requires better maintenance Overcrowded with group tourists Breakfast is fairly basic and you have to fight with the crowds! Obviously an old hotel but efforts has been made to make it look new OVERALL: Don't expect 5 star facilities and service. You are only paying 2.5 star price for a 3 star hotel. So, I am reasonably satisfied

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Royal Singapore
HotelInfo.Address: 36 Newton Road, Singapore 307964, Singapore
